quetzal.model.integritymodel module

class quetzal.model.integritymodel.IntegrityModel(debug=False, walk_on_road=False, epsg=None, coordinates_unit=None, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

integrity_fix_circular_lines()[source]

The model does not work with circular lines, this function delete them.

Requires

self.links

Builds

self.links – links without circular lines

integrity_fix_collision(prefixes={'links': 'link_', 'nodes': 'node_', 'zones': 'zone_'})[source]

Fix index collision by adding prefixes.

Requires

  • self.nodes

  • self.links

  • self.zones

Parameters

prefixes (dict, optional) – _description_, by default {‘nodes’: ‘node_’, ‘links’: ‘link_’, ‘zones’: ‘zone_’}

Builds

  • self.nodes – add prefix node_ to index

  • self.links – add prefix link_ to index

  • self.zones – add prefix zone_ to index

integrity_fix_nodeset_consistency()[source]

If some nodes are referenced in links but not in nodes, delete the nodes (or links). Makes the same thing for road_links and road_nodes if they exist

Requires

  • self.links

  • self.nodes

Builds

  • self.links – corrected geodataframe

  • self.nodes – corrected geodataframe

integrity_fix_road_network(cutoff=10, recursive_depth=1)[source]

Wrapper of corrections of the road network. Fix isolated roads, dead ends, and nodeset consistency.

Requires

  • self.road_links

  • self.road_nodes

Builds

  • self.road_links – corrected geodataframe

  • self.road_nodes – corrected geodataframe

integrity_fix_road_nodeset_consistency()[source]

If some nodes are referenced in road_links but not in road_nodes, delete the road_nodes (or road_links).

Requires

  • self.road_links

  • self.road_nodes

Builds

  • self.road_links – corrected geodataframe

  • self.road_nodes – corrected geodataframe

integrity_fix_sequences()[source]

Fix the sequences of links.

Requires

self.links

Builds

self.links – corected links

integrity_test_all(errors='raise', verbose=True)[source]

Performs all the tests of the class IntegrityModel.

Parameters

  • errors (str, optional, default 'raise') – If ‘ignore’, will not raise exception

  • verbose (bool, optional, default True) – If False, will not print results

integrity_test_circular_lines()[source]

The model does not work with circular lines, this function is looking for them.

Requires

self.links

Builds

circular_lines – list of circular lines to be modified by user

integrity_test_collision(sets=('links', 'nodes', 'zones', 'road_links', 'road_nodes'))[source]

Test if indexes of ‘links’, ‘nodes’, ‘zones’, ‘road_links’, ‘road_nodes’ contain same numbers, which may create errors. Return list of attributes that may create errors.

Requires

  • self.nodes

  • self.links

  • self.zones

Parameters

sets (tuple, optional, default ('links', 'nodes', 'zones', 'road_links', 'road_nodes')) – set of attributes of the stepmodel to consider in the test

integrity_test_dead_ends(cutoff=5)[source]

Look for dead-ends in the road network. only the dead-ends with a dead-rank lower than the cutoff will be identified.

Requires

self.road_links

integrity_test_isolated_roads()[source]

test if some roads are not connected to the graph. Returns the number of roads not connected.

Requires

self.road_links

integrity_test_nodeset_consistency()[source]

Test if some nodes are referenced in links but not in nodes.

Requires

  • self.links

  • self.nodes

integrity_test_road_network(cutoff=10)[source]

Wrapper of tests of the road network. Test isolated roads, dead ends, and nodeset consistency.

Requires

  • self.road_links

  • self.road_nodes

integrity_test_road_nodeset_consistency()[source]

Test if some nodes are referenced in road_links but not in road_nodes.

Requires

  • self.road_links

  • self.road_nodes

integrity_test_sequences()[source]

Test if the sequence of links is consistent.

Requires

self.links

Builds

self.broken_sequences – list of lines in which there is a problem in the link_sequence
